text: Fujian Tianxin Football Club () was a professional Chinese football club. The team was based in Jinjiang, Fujian. ==History== The club was formed by Shen Wence in 2005 as an amateur football club. It took part in amateur football league in Fuzhou for years. On January 16, 2017 the club officially converted into a professional team when it aimed for the qualification to the China League Two.福州首家职业足球俱乐部揭牌 今年将冲击中乙联赛 In the 2017 season Zhao Tuqiang was appointed as the head coach. After winning the champion of 2017 Fujian Football Super League, the club enter into the second round of CAL, and managed to qualify for the third round. In the knockout stage, the club beat Wuhan Chufeng Heli, but after being defeated by Qiqihar Zhongjian and Yanbian Beiguo, the club eventually ranked 7th in the 2017 CAL. However, the club was substituted to promote to the China League Two,正式公布 | 2018年中国足球协会乙级联赛参赛球队 due to the withdrawal of Zhaoqing Hengtai, Chengdu Qbao and Shanghai JuJu Sports, as well as Qiqihar Zhongjian and Lhasa Urban Construction Investment being ineligible for promotion. On March 5, 2019, the club switched its home ground from Fuzhou, Fujian to Jinjiang, Fujian.中乙福建天信新赛季联赛主场迁至晋江 On February 3, 2020, the club was disqualified for 2020 China League Two after they failed to submit the salary and bonus confirmation form. On May 15 the club announced that it had solved its financial problems, moved to Ningde and been renamed Fujian Ningde FC, but it failed to regain the entrance to 2020 China League Two. ==Managerial history== * Zhao Tuqiang (2017–2020) ==Results== All-time league rankings *As of the end of 2019 season. {|class="wikitable sortable" width=100% style=text-align:Center |- !Year !Div ! ! ! ! ! ! ! !Pts !width=2%|Pos. !width=4%|FA Cup !width=2%|Super Cup !|AFC !Att./G !Stadium |- | 2017 || bgcolor=#c1ddfd|4 || || || || || || || || || 7 || DNQ || DNQ || DNQ || || Fujian Normal University Sports Center Stadium |- | 2018 || 3 || 28 || 12 || 8 || 8 || 33 || 25 || 8 || 44 || 7 || R2 || DNQ || DNQ || 1,853 || Fujian Olympic Sports Center Stadium Fujian Normal University Sports Center Stadium Haixia Olympic Center Stadium |- | 2019 || 3 || 30 || 13 || 5 || 12 || 32 || 42 || -6 || 44 || 13 || R1 || DNQ || DNQ || || Quanzhou College of Technology Stadium |} * In group stage.
